meanings.definition: A person or animal that catches rats.
meanings.sent1: The brave ratter quickly caught the sneaky rat in the barn.
meanings.sent2: The farm dog was an excellent ratter, keeping the barn free of rodents.
meanings.sent3: The little ratter chased the rat around the yard, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled ratter, hunting down the truth in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The ratter's sharp eyes and quick reflexes made it a formidable opponent for any rat.

meanings.definition: A device used to kill rats.
meanings.sent1: The old-fashioned ratter snapped shut, trapping the rat inside.
meanings.sent2: The farmer set up multiple ratters around the barn to keep the rodents away.
meanings.sent3: The mechanical ratter malfunctioned and started chasing the cat instead of the rat.
meanings.sent4: The ratter lay in wait, ready to strike at any unsuspecting rodent that crossed its path.
meanings.sent5: The powerful jaws of the ratter made quick work of the rat, ending the infestation in no time.

meanings.definition: A computer program designed to detect and remove computer viruses.
meanings.sent1: The new ratter software quickly scanned the computer and eliminated the virus.
meanings.sent2: She installed a reliable ratter on her laptop to keep it safe from online threats.
meanings.sent3: The ratter program worked tirelessly, like a digital superhero protecting the computer.
meanings.sent4: The advanced ratter algorithm was like a shield, defending the system from harmful viruses.
meanings.sent5: With the ratter running in the background, the computer was always safeguarded against malicious software.
